results.name: Number of partitions of n into distinct parts, where the difference between the number of odd parts and the number of even parts is 2.
comment: With offset 6 number of partitions of n into distinct parts, where the difference between the number of odd parts and the number of even parts is -2.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 4..1000
maple: b:= proc(n, i, t) option remember; `if`(n>i*(i+1)/2 or
mathematica: a /@ Range[4, 80] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 10 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
